co.edu.icesi.nextfruit.modules.model

Class ColorDistribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Color
      • co.edu.icesi.nextfruit.modules.model.ColorDistribution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.Paint, java.awt.Transparency, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ColorDistribution>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MatchingColor

    public class ColorDistribution
extends java.awt.Color
implements java.lang.Comparable<ColorDistribution>
    This class is used to wrap in xyY (double[]) color into a java.awt.Color. It can be used to count the number of similar colors (repeat property) based on the xyY color space. It implements comparable witch sorts the classes according to the number of repetitions (repeat property).
    Author:
    cjortegon
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • ColorDistribution

        public ColorDistribution(double[] bgr)
        The constructor uses a bgr format (blue, green, red) where the 3 values are in the range (0..255)
        Parameters:
        bgr - double vector, size 3. [0] Blue, [1] Green, [2] Red.

        public void restartRepeatCount()

      • getRepeat

        public int getRepeat()
        Returns:
        The repeat property.

      • transform2xyY

        public void transform2xyY(CameraCalibration calibration)
        This method initializes the xyY property to compare the color with others in the xyY color space.
        Parameters:
        calibration - The calibration object from the camera used to read the BGR colors.

      • getxyY

        public double[] getxyY()
        Returns:
        The values in xyY color space. Null if transform2xyY() hasn't been called.

      • isCloseToXY

        public boolean isCloseToXY(double[] xyY,
                           double sensibility)
        Tells you if the given xyY color is closed to this color. 
         transform2xyY() must be called first.
        Parameters:
        xyY - The color to compare.
        sensibility - The distance between colors. May be in the range of (0 -> 1.42). Zero means an exact coincidence and max value (1.42) means that all colors could match to it.
        Returns:
        false if transform2xyY() hasn't been called or if the color is not close enough according to sensibility. True otherwise.
